content.question: Zucchini is produced in a perfectly competitive market with a downward-sloping demand curve and an upward-sloping supply curve. Dawson Farm is a typical perfectly competitive farm that produces and sells zucchini at the equilibrium price of <math alttext="$1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1.75</mtext></math> per pound. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: No buyer in the market is willing to pay more than <math alttext="$1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1.75</mtext></math> per pound for zucchini.
No buyer in the market is willing to pay more than <math alttext="$1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1.75</mtext></math> per pound for zucchini from Dawson Farm.
Market demand for zucchini will increase if Dawson Farm lowers its price below <math alttext="$1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1.75</mtext></math> per pound.
Dawson Farm would lose some but not all of its customers if it increases the price above <math alttext="$1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1.75</mtext></math> per pound for zucchini.
Dawson Farm would likely be able to increase the demand for its zucchini by advertising.

content.answer: No buyer in the market is willing to pay more than <math alttext="$1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1.75</mtext></math> per pound for zucchini from Dawson Farm.

topic.text: 2.6: Market Equilibrium and Consumer and Producer Surplus

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
